document_data.name: Vintor
document_data.mainbody: '''Vintor''' was a county on the western coast of [[Tethyr]] famous for its wines.
document_data.Geography:
Vintor was one of the counties of the [[Purple Marches]]. It lay west of counties [[Elemetar]] and [[Bardshyr]] on the other side of the [[Red River]] and south of the [[wikipedia:en:Duchy|duchy]] of [[Kamlann]] on the other side of the [[Sulduskoon River]].

A large portion of the county was a region called the [[Purple Hills]], a land known for its cider, pipeweed, and wine.

Its two largest settlements were [[Barrowsmorn]] and [[Vineshade]].
document_data.Population: County Vintor included a high percentage of [[halfling]]s among its populace, since they admired the hilly landscape of the region.
document_data.Government: In [[1370 DR]], Vintor was governed by Count [[Krimmon Amethystall]], who was also the Fleet Chancellor of Tethyr. The official county seat was [[Amethyst Hall]].
